head.title: Ricardo D. Kohn, Lisa J. Markovits

hedline.hl1: Ricardo D. Kohn, Lisa J. Markovits

block.p: Lisa J. Markovits, the daughter of Barbara A. Markovits of New York and Robert L. Markovits of Middletown, N.Y., was married yesterday to Ricardo D. Kohn, a son of Doris Deitel and Pedro Kohn, both of Quito, Ecuador. Rabbi Irving J. Block performed the ceremony at the Brotherhood Synagogue in New York.

Ms. Markovits, 24, is keeping her name. She graduated magna cum laude from Cornell University and received a master's degree in law and diplomacy from Tufts University. Her father is a partner in Markovits & Markovits, a law firm in Middletown, and a principal in the Brotherhood Winery in Washingtonville, N.Y. Her mother is an accountant in New York.

Lisa J. Markovits, the daughter of Barbara A. Markovits of New York and Robert L. Markovits of Middletown, N.Y., was married yesterday to Ricardo D. Kohn, a son of Doris Deitel and Pedro Kohn, both of Quito, Ecuador. Rabbi Irving J. Block performed the ceremony at the Brotherhood Synagogue in New York.

Ms. Markovits, 24, is keeping her name. She graduated magna cum laude from Cornell University and received a master's degree in law and diplomacy from Tufts University. Her father is a partner in Markovits & Markovits, a law firm in Middletown, and a principal in the Brotherhood Winery in Washingtonville, N.Y. Her mother is an accountant in New York.

Mr. Kohn, 27, was until recently a consultant at A. T. & T. Bell Laboratories in Holmdel, N.J. He graduated from Cornell, from which he also received a master's degree in operations research and industrial engineering. His mother is a classical pianist. His father is the general manager of Conduit del Ecuador, a steel-pipe manufacturer in Quito.
